intro: Phoradendron jaliscense, commonly known as the Mexican soapbark tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its fruits are legumes containing seeds. It is often found growing as an epiphyte on other trees in tropical and subtropical regions. The tree is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies.
